body_html:
Thanks for the detailed report and the debugging @priyankjain.

@karmel : If I may summarize, there is a discrepancy between the Python and C++ implementations of loading a saved model where the former raises an exception on a missing variables.index file and the latter doesn't. Though, admittedly this can only happen if someone explicitly removed the variables.index file from the saved model directory.
body_text:
Thanks for the detailed report and the debugging @priyankjain.
@karmel : If I may summarize, there is a discrepancy between the Python and C++ implementations of loading a saved model where the former raises an exception on a missing variables.index file and the latter doesn't. Though, admittedly this can only happen if someone explicitly removed the variables.index file from the saved model directory.
body:
Thanks for the detailed report and the debugging @priyankjain.

@karmel : If I may summarize, there is a discrepancy between the Python and [C++](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/4aa639c0cbb47f4707f735e0cc80f4c39506d928/tensorflow/cc/saved_model/loader.cc#L171) implementations of loading a saved model where the former raises an exception on a missing `variables.index` file and the latter doesn't. Though, admittedly this can only happen if someone explicitly removed the `variables.index` file from the saved model directory.
